data.title: Save and restore the environment for windows
data.body:
This PR more robustly handles the environment in atom-window and the browser window. It:
- Allows an environment to persist when Atom is completely exited and then re-launched, by serializing the environment and restoring it along with the window ("Should process.env be serialized and reused when re-opening an existing project?" from #4126)
- Allows multiple invocations of `FOO=blah atom .` and `FOO=bleh atom .` to result in an updated environment for an existing window ("Should process.env be updated if atom is invoked from the shell for the same directory multiple times?" from #4126)
- Extends #11054
- Partially fixes  #4126

**Note:** This fix is recommended for cherry picking into the beta channel once merged, as it fixes issues present in the 1.7.x beta.

/cc @lee-dohm

data.title: `script/build` fails while cloning nathansobo/node-plist due to “zero-padded file modes”
data.body:
### Description

Trying to build Atom from a fresh clone fails, see [the error log](https://gist.github.com/mkhl/3112bffc4d6562c1d369fe101b27abdf).

While installing apm, cloning nathansobo/node-plist fails with the message: `error: object 3fa653483030560fd76ea99669255fa047882026: zeroPaddedFilemode: contains zero-padded file modes`.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. `git clone https://github.com/atom/atom.git`
2. `cd atom`
3. `./script/build` (I actually ran `env HOME=/Users/mkhl/.atom-dev  ./script/build --install-dir /Users/mkhl/Applications/Atom.app`)

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
Atom builds

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
While installing apm, cloning nathansobo/node-plist fails with the message: `error: object 3fa653483030560fd76ea99669255fa047882026: zeroPaddedFilemode: contains zero-padded file modes`
[See the full error log.](https://gist.github.com/mkhl/3112bffc4d6562c1d369fe101b27abdf)
### Versions

```
> git rev-parse HEAD
a058f3721f4ee888a643e2aff3af30a839056e4c
> atom --version
1.6.1
> apm --version
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.8.0
> sw_vers
ProductName:    Mac OS X
ProductVersion: 10.11.4
BuildVersion:   15E65
```

This version of git is from Homebrew, the one provided by Apple behaves identically.

```
> /usr/bin/git --version
git version 2.6.4 (Apple Git-63)
```

data.title: Opening XML Plists as "Old Style"
data.body:
Using Atom 1.6 on OS X 10.11.

When I open my XML plist files, Atom correctly detects it's a plist, but it chooses "Old Style" instead of "XML" , so the syntax highlighting is wrong. I think it should probably default to XML if there is no detection beyond the file extension.

My plists start with 

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN" "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
<plist version="1.0">
```

Like normal.

data.title: The link (https://atom.io/roadmap?app) from Atom 1.6.1 to the roadmap does no longer work
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Starting (at least) with Atom 1.6.1 the menu option Help > Roadmap (https://atom.io/roadmap?app) shows a 404 error page.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Use Menu "Help > Roadmap"
### Versions

atom --version
1.6.1

apm --version
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.3
git 2.6.0.windows.1
visual studio 2013

data.title: Reporting "incompatible native module" on non-existing transitive devDependency.
data.body:
I no longer can load my package on Atom beta 1.7.*

"Failed to require the main module of 'Ensime' because it requires an incompatible native module.
Run `apm rebuild` in the package directory to resolve."
- First of, this message doesn't tell me which module is problematic so I had to debug - wouldn't it be super easy to just report the failing module?
- apm rebuild doesn't help even when it succeeds.

Reported on my package https://github.com/ensime/ensime-atom/issues/221

I just went to hell and back replacing chokidar to a pre fsevent-using-node-pre-gyp failing apm rebuild in the thought that this was the issue.

The problem I have now it that Atom reports a transitive devDependency from grunt-ts on fsevents as incompatible. Debugging in package.js:

```
JSON.stringify(this.incompatibleModules)
"[{"path":"/Users/viktor/.atom/packages/Ensime/node_modules/ensime-client/node_modules/grunt-ts/node_modules/fsevents","name":"fsevents","version":"0.3.8","error":"Module version mismatch. Expected 47, got 46."}]"
```

This file doesn't even exist! grunt-ts is a devDependency to compile Typescript on ensime-client so it's not in there:

```
~/d/p/atom-ensime ❯❯❯ ll /Users/viktor/.atom/packages/Ensime/node_modules/ensime-client/node_modules/grunt-ts
ls: /Users/viktor/.atom/packages/Ensime/node_modules/ensime-client/node_modules/grunt-ts: No such file or directory
```

I see two issues:
- Atom is reporting issues on files that doesn't exist. Is it reading package.json including devDeps and constructing those paths just to confuse? Or is it cache? 
- Even if only failed on actual physical files in node_modules, my dev workflow with npm link (as described here http://flight-manual.atom.io/behind-atom/sections/developing-node-modules/) would be screwed since the transitive devDep would be there while developing.

data.title: Find and replace in all project files
data.body:
This is not an issue but a feature request. Sorry if it already exists... I'm very new to Atom and still finding my way.

Is there a way to (or is planned to be added a) "Find and replace" in all project files *_and/or *_ "Find and replace in all opened documents" features like in Notepad++ ?

data.title: Fix potential null reference callback invokation in script/clean
data.body:
A bug was introduced in https://github.com/atom/atom/commit/76f9f43e6aec3d53b1b23b893648eac238090a60, which boiled down to not checking whether the (seemingly) optional callback in `ChildProcess.safeExec` is defined before invokation.

I wasn't sure whether we wanted to add a condition on the `else` statement, or set `callback` to a noop function. I opted for the formed, but I'm open to suggestions.

/cc @thedaniel @abe33 @damieng 

---

Fixes #11328

data.title: script/clean fails with error
data.body:
On OS X, with Node 5.8.0 and atom at dea5c5560e7a98977cf1d265f55686c1efc1d04b, running `./script/clean` does not succeed:

```
[atom (master):zap:]> ./script/clean 
/Users/daniel/atom/atom/script/utils/child-process-wrapper.js:21
     callback(null);
     ^

TypeError: callback is not a function
   at /Users/daniel/atom/atom/script/utils/child-process-wrapper.js:21:7
   at ChildProcess.exithandler (child_process.js:193:7)
   at emitTwo (events.js:100:13)
   at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:185:7)
   at maybeClose (internal/child_process.js:850:16)
   at Socket.<anonymous> (internal/child_process.js:323:11)
   at emitOne (events.js:90:13)
   at Socket.emit (events.js:182:7)
   at Pipe._onclose (net.js:475:12)
```

This appears to be a regression introduced by https://github.com/atom/atom/commit/76f9f43e6aec3d53b1b23b893648eac238090a60 - cc @nathansobo  @damieng 

Thanks to @abe33 and @thomasjo for helping investigate / confirm.

data.title: Blank files after updating to 1.6.1
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Key Info

**OS:** Windows 10
**Pre-update version:** Atom 1.6.0
**Post-update version:** Atom 1.6.1
**Update method:** Auto-update

Spoken to @thomasjo in slack channel (Recommended posting here), opening files on my PC are fine, network drive issues, SAMBA mounted network drive in windows, no issues before this.

Coming back to work on Tuesday atom had auto-updated, I believe to 1.6.1. This caused issues where the application would hang for 30-40 seconds upon basically any action, maybe get as far as clicking a button for it to hang again.

As you can imagine, hard to develop anything! So I completely uninstalled everything, removed all traces from %appdata% and my user folder (.atom - This is backed up) - I reinstalled a fresh copy of 1.6.1 from the site, everything seemed to be working, until I added a project folder and opened a file... Blank. Nothing, Nada. Even stranger, if I then close atom, relaunch, close the file and undo the close tab, it has it's contents... But no other file does.

Again, after this I removed all traces again and installed 1.6.0 with no luck resolving the issue, followed by trying out the 1.7.0 beta 3.

**Errors in developer console:**
`Error refreshing repository status:(anonymous function) @ git-repository-async.js:971
git-repository-async.js:972 Error: Failed to resolve path '\\fs1\Propeller Files\Clients\rockliffe-drupal.com\versions\nick\httpdocs\sites\all\modules\examples': The system cannot find the file specified.
(…)(anonymous function) @ git-repository-async.js:972
git-repository-async.js:971 Error refreshing repository status:(anonymous function) @ git-repository-async.js:971
git-repository-async.js:972 Error: Failed to resolve path '\\fs1\Propeller Files\Clients\rockliffe-drupal.com\versions\nick\httpdocs\sites\all\modules\gauth': The system cannot find the file specified.
(…)(anonymous function) @ git-repository-async.js:972
git-repository-async.js:971 Error refreshing repository status:(anonymous function) @ git-repository-async.js:971
git-repository-async.js:972 Error: Failed to resolve path '\\fs1\Propeller Files\Clients\rockliffe-drupal.com\versions\nick\httpdocs\sites\all\modules\shib_auth': The system cannot find the file specified.
(…)`

data.title: Fix pinch-to-zoom disabling
data.body:
Fixes #8850.

There seems to be an issue with how Chromium handles the input data for the `setZoomLevelLimits` API: I suspect there's some kind of guard clause that ignores that function call whenever the `min` and the `max` level limits are the same.

As a stopgap measure, I have changed the max limit to be slightly larger than the minimum so that the configuration gets enforced by Chromium without actually allowing the user to zoom.

/cc: @zcbenz for :eyes: on the electron side.
/cc: @atom/core

data.title: Fix emoji rendering on OSX
data.body:
Fixes #10403.

On OS X, we noticed that some emojis were not being displayed correctly. This is a problem with the rendering mechanism that Chromium uses and is present in Chrome 50 as well:

![screen shot 2016-03-31 at 11 26 59](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/14171984/2f63fc88-f736-11e5-895d-f48cca510511.png)

However, it seems like it has been fixed on Chrome 51 Canary, where the test above works perfectly:

![screen shot 2016-03-31 at 11 26 34](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/14172028/598ebfe8-f736-11e5-892d-e8068e1b7641.png)
### A workaround

Even with Chrome 50, however, I noticed that GitHub.com was rendering emojis correctly without using PNGs:

![screen shot 2016-03-31 at 11 48 34](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/14172067/88db969a-f736-11e5-851c-151763d630cd.png)

It seems, in fact, that adding the "Apple Color Emoji" font to the list of font families allows Chrome to pick up the right glyph to render instead of the ugly box:

![screen shot 2016-03-31 at 11 31 04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/14172145/deb5f330-f736-11e5-808e-0bd574c4722a.png)

![screen shot 2016-03-31 at 11 31 09](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/14172149/e1ae8958-f736-11e5-9f7f-2297f8df8090.png)

As expected, removing it, causes the box to appear (again, this works fine in Chrome Canary 51):

![screen shot 2016-03-31 at 11 30 31](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/14172172/f9bd9836-f736-11e5-8c18-d55545381742.png)
![screen shot 2016-03-31 at 11 30 24](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/14172173/fc8e0082-f736-11e5-9b1f-f8493d3734f1.png)

This is the exact workaround I have employed in Atom as well; indeed, we should be able to remove it  as soon as Chrome 51 gets released and Electron is updated.

/cc: @atom/core

data.title: Add restorePreviousWindowsOnStart setting
Update Grammar In Spec Files
data.body: Update grammar

data.title: Fresh install on arch, running atom makes it crash
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

I installed atom on antergos (which is arch linux) following instruction on github.
After the installation i runned atom, it wasn't possible to run it using atom i had to use atom-beta.
The UI appers and the program instantly crash.
I would've try to downgrade freetype2 as some people suggested on issue #11198  but i don't have the apm command, have to use apm-beta.

Return is : 
apm-beta install freetype2@2.6.2-1
Installing freetype2@2.6.2-1 to /home/zipeldiablo/.atom/packages ✗
Request for package information failed: Not Found
### Steps to Reproduce
1. sudo pacman -S --needed gconf base-devel git nodejs npm libgnome-keyring python2
2. export PYTHON=/usr/bin/python2 (missed this step)
3. git clone https://github.com/atom/atom
4. cd atom
5. git fetch -p
6. git checkout $(git describe --tags `git rev-list --tags --max-count=1`)
7. script/build
   8 . sudo script/grunt install
8. atom-beta (to launch it, will crash)
9. apm-beta install freetype2@2.6.2-1 (to try to downgrade the package)
   also tried : apm-beta downgrading package freetype2 (2.6.3-1 => 2.6.2-1)
   zsh: parse error near `)'

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

launching atom with the atom command, program will load successfully
**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

Have to launch program using atom-beta, crash on boot
### Versions

atom-beta -version
Atom    : 1.7.0-beta4
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

data.title: Clicking on "Replace in selection" clears selection
data.body: If I have a block of text selected and I want to replace something in that selection, if I click on the "replace in selection" button in the search controls, that clears the selection so that I have to re-highlight it.

data.title: Update nodegit
data.body: Fixes build on Windows machines that don’t have bash. Somehow this apparently worked on our CI machines already.

data.title: Manual checking for updates instead of automatic at startup
data.body:
Please allow an option to not check for updates automatically whenever I open Atom.
This isn't the same as this issue: #1882 where you are still checking, but just not downloading.

I'm behind a corporate proxy which notices requests all the time from atom when I open it.
This isn't that great for people on mobile data plans either.

If we could instead just do the manual check for update when we choose to, that would be great. Thank you.

`Atom    : 1.7.0-beta2
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
`

data.title: Unable to install atom on my Win 7 64 bit
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [ ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

I was trying to install Atom on my Windows 7 64 bit and I have Admin rights to install the applications.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Downloaded Atom stable version
2. Tried using "Run as Administrator"
3. Installation was aborted and provided me the log

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

data.title: Add request for OS and version to Issue Template
Serialize async git
data.body:
Another entry in the saga of #11214.

The remaining problem comes down to nodegit's threading model. Nodegit uses a lock to protect against cross-thread memory corruption, race conditions, etc. It also uses libuv's thread pool to do git operations off the main thread.

The problem is that if a lot of git work gets queued up (as happens any time the window comes to the foreground), we can end up with git operations on all of libuv's threads, waiting to acquire the lock. That sucks, because node uses that same thread pool to do all its async work. So we end up blocking node from doing most anything until our git operations are done.

This is most noticeable on slow file systems (e.g., network drives). We’d essentially end up blocking node from doing anything while we waited on IO.

Instead of using nodegit’s locking, we’ll use our own serialization mechanism.

This should also afford us more concurrency in the future if/when we need it.

data.title: Handle auto-updater errors
data.body:
This PR propagates the auto-update errors to the renderer process so that we can handle the error state in the about package and show an appropriate error label.

/cc: @thedaniel @joshaber @atom/core

data.title: Mac OS GPU crash
data.body:
### Description

On Mac OS X 10.9.5 Atom causes a crash of the GPU spontaneously. The crash happens in Mac Fullscreen mode and normal window mode. Happened three times at the same mac. The screen went gray and the mac didn't respond. Even keyboard shortcuts for killing Atom or shutting down didn't work. I must kill the mac with a long press on the power button. After the third time the mac had a hard drive failure and I need hours to revive him, so I'm afraid of using Atom or debugging it. But maybe others can solve the issue. 

If it helps, the crash happens always when I'm editing .less files. The first two times I tried to define a variable for a font-familiy, the third time I tired to set the font-familiy directly an it worked (even the autocomplete). But before or while I save the change Atom crashes.

Here are the kernel logs before the crash:

> 29.03.16 17:46:16,000 kernel[0]: [1:0:0] GPU HangState 0x00000000, HangFlags 0x00000006: IndividualEngineHang 0, NonEngineBlockHang 1, FenceNotRetired 1, PerEngineReset 0, FullAsicReset 1

Also there is a Atom Helper [Crash Report](https://gist.github.com/Entwicklerpages/fd89110d7c3c842eaae898238372afd1)
### Versions

I'm using Atom 1.6.0
I have installed the following packages:
- build@0.58.0
- build-npm-apm@0.10.0
- minimap@4.21.0
  Mac OS X 10.9.5 - iMac Mid 2011
  GPU: AMD Radeon HD 6970M 2048 MB

data.title: Why Atom installation requires .Net?
data.body: Why Atom installation on Windows requires .Net? Should not Atom/Electron be platform on its own?
